availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Ohio, U.S.A. General. Chillicothe, Ohio native. Graduate from the United States Military Academy in 1853. Served in the U.S. Army as second-lieutenant from 1853 to 1860. Teacher at Brooklyn Collegiate and Polytechnic Institute in Brooklyn, New York in 1860. Served in the 33rd Ohio Volunteer Infantry Regiment (U.S.A.) as colonel in 1861. Served as division commander in the Army of the Ohio as brigadier general in 1862.

ab.bibl: Whitelaw Reid, Ohio in the War: Her Statesmen, Her Generals, and Soldiers, Volume I: History of the State During the War, and the Lives of Her Generals (New York: Moore, Wilstach and Baldwin, 1868), p. 919-920.
